item.title: Death Stranding IP Now Belongs to Kojima Productions
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/death-stranding-ip/

Following the announcement that a Death Stranding Director’s Cut will be coming to Xbox, Kojima Productions has also announced that the Death Stranding IP now belongs to the developer.

The announcement, which came via automaton-media, read, “In addition, KOJIMA PRODUCTIONS announced that the IP for this work will belong to the studio. They said that they will continue to connect more fans around the world in various forms of entertainment”.

Death Stranding 2: On The Beach is scheduled to release for the PlayStation 5 in 2025. However, recent news could suggest that the game could launch on day one on the Xbox platform and PC, too, if PlayStation didn’t get some form of marketing/exclusivity deal.

Regardless, today’s announcement of the Death Stranding Director’s Cut on Xbox suggests that Death Stranding 2 will eventually be released on Xbox and PC.

We’ll have to wait for an additional announcement of such details, with the most likely announcement coming at Geoff Keighley’s The Game Awards this December (granted, if PlayStation doesn’t have some exclusivity).

Death Stranding on the Xbox will be published by 505 Games.

item.title: Death Stranding Director’s Cut Announced for Xbox Series X|S
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/death-stranding-xbox-released/

Kojima Productions has just announced that Death Stranding’s Director’s Cut will be coming to Xbox Series X|S and PC today.

The surprising announcement was made on the official Kojima Productions X account (formerly Twitter), where the developers announced, “DEATH STRANDING DIRECTOR’S CUT – Xbox Series X|S Edition & Windows PC Edition – On sale today at a special limited time offer of 50% off!”

You can now buy Death Stranding Director’s Cut at the Xbox Store here, where the game is available for £17.50. The game is also available at the 50% discount rate on both Steam and Epic Games. The game will be published by 505 Games.

Death Stranding was first released for the PlayStation 4 in November 2019 and later for the PlayStation 5 in September 2021 with a Director’s Cut. According to review aggregator Metacritic, the game received ‘generally favorable’ reviews.

As of July 2021, the game sold 5 million units.

Death Stranding 2, a sequel to the original, is also in development and is scheduled to be released in 2025.
